body_html:
@tatatodd: THANKS!!! Using make (instead of Bazel) to build tensorflow:

https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/tree/master/tensorflow/contrib/makefile#raspberry-pi

worked.... and label_image builds correctly now.

I also had to update protobuf to 3.2.0, others should take note.

My conclusion is that Bazel on Raspberry Pi is a huge waste of time, it just doesn't work, likely a problem with defining the build for Raspberry Pi. Also, it crashed Pi frequently (yes, I used the memory tips).

"make" is 8 hours faster and works correctly.

Also, others should note that the statement
"The recommended way to build TensorFlow from source is using the Bazel open-source build system" at:

https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/tree/master/tensorflow/contrib/makefile#raspberry-pi

does NOT necessarily apply to Raspberry Pi!

This advice took me down completely the wrong road for a week. Beware!

body:
@tatatodd: THANKS!!! Using make (instead of Bazel) to build tensorflow:

https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/tree/master/tensorflow/contrib/makefile#raspberry-pi

worked....  and label_image builds correctly now.

I also had to update protobuf to 3.2.0, others should take note.

My conclusion is that Bazel on Raspberry Pi is a *huge waste of time*, it just doesn't work, likely a problem with defining the build for Raspberry Pi. Also, it crashed Pi frequently (yes, I used the memory tips).  

"make" is 8 hours faster and works correctly.

Also, others should note that the statement
"The recommended way to build TensorFlow from source is using the Bazel open-source build system" at:

https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/tree/master/tensorflow/contrib/makefile#raspberry-pi

does NOT necessarily apply to Raspberry Pi!

This advice took me down completely the wrong road for a week. Beware!
